metadata.title: CVE-2019-6799 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin before 4.8.5. When the AllowArbitraryServer configuration setting is set to true, with the use of a rogue MySQL server, an attacker can read any file on the server that the web server's user can access. This is related to the mysql.allow_local_infile PHP configuration, and the inadvertent ignoring of "options(MYSQLI_OPT_LOCAL_INFILE" calls. It was discovered that phpMyAdmin would allow sensitive files to be leaked if certain configuration options were set. An attacker could use this vulnerability to access confidential information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-6799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.9.2+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.9.2+dfsg1-1').
